entry.title: K-Pop Titans Blackpink Launch Roblox Metaverse Experience
entry.summary: Blackpink: The Palace launches this week in Roblox and will evolve over the next year with metaverse experiences for K-pop fans.

entry.title: Gaming Influencers FaZe Banks, Nadeshot Among Friend.tech's Top Earners
entry.summary: The esports and gaming titans behind FaZe Clan and 100 Thieves respectively are making bank on buzzy social token app Friend.tech.

entry.title: Friend.tech Founders Say Viral Crypto App Is Surprising Them Too: 'We Want to Catch Our Breath'
entry.summary: The founders of Friend.tech tell Decrypt what's next for the tokenized social media platform—and where their heads are at following the boom.

entry.title: Friend.tech Is Crypto’s Latest Obsession—But Critics Say It Won’t End Well
entry.summary: Celebrities are signing up on the protocol, which is already bigger than Tron and Uniswap. But is it sustainable?

entry.title: Coinbase Buys Stake in Circle, Dissolving USDC Issuer Centre
entry.summary: Circle will now be the only issuer of the USDC stablecoin.

entry.title: Crypto and NFT Games Are Still Launching on Steam Despite Ongoing Ban
entry.summary: Popular PC marketplace Steam banned blockchain games in 2021, but developers are finding various ways to work around—or within—the rules.

entry.title: ‘Disappointing’ ETF Decisions By SEC Blamed for Bitcoin Selloff
entry.summary: Amid a widespread crypto sell-off and SEC stalling, CoinShares reports that institutional investors sold $55 million worth of Bitcoin in the past week.

entry.title: Crypto Fund Misled Clients With Promises of 2,700% Returns, SEC Claims
entry.summary: Titan promised investors annual returns of over 2,700% with its crypto product—but the SEC alleges it was a con.

entry.title: AI Won't Lead to an Unemployment Crisis, but Jobs Are at Risk: Report
entry.summary: The International Labor Organization says artificial intelligence threatens working women more than men.

entry.title: Market Is Sleeping on These AI Investments, Says Ark
entry.summary: Cathie Wood's investment firm urges caution before looking to mega cap tech giants for AI exposure.

entry.title: Binance Euro Transfers ‘Still Available’, Says Paysafe After Erroneous Tweet
entry.summary: Binance’s users have until September 25 to conduct euro transactions via SEPA, according to Paysafe and Binance.

entry.title: Who’s Who in Global Crypto Regulation
entry.summary: It is difficult to properly assess cryptocurrencies through the lenses of traditional finance—it is even challenging to determine which agencies may be responsible for their oversight.

entry.title: Kenyan Government Launches Committee to Examine Worldcoin
entry.summary: The move comes just three weeks after the African nation's authorities suspended Worldcoin’s activities in the country.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: ETH Linked to Ethereum ICO Participant, Vitalik Buterin Is on the Move
entry.summary: Roughly $1.3 million in Ethereum between an eight-year-old address and Vitalik Buterin has bought up altcoins or been sent to Coinbase.

entry.title: China Is Taking Its Social Credit System to the Metaverse: Report
entry.summary: Officials in China have reportedly put forth a set of proposals for a “government-controlled internet” to a UN metaverse focus group.

entry.title: Another Lucky Solo Miner Nabs $160,000 Bitcoin Block Reward
entry.summary: With a mere 1 PH/s in hash power, the lucky miner enjoys vastly fewer resources than what major industrial-scale Bitcoin mining pools boast.

entry.title: Meme Coins PEPE, SHIB Plummet More Than 20% Over the Week
entry.summary: Markets are down bad and meme coins—the riskier assets—are bearing the brunt. Last week’s chaotic Shibarium launch also helped sink the price of SHIB.

entry.title: Base Network Sees Activity Soar Past Arbitrum, Optimism Amid Friend.tech Frenzy
entry.summary: The Twitter-linked crypto app has taken off, lifting activity and the amount in fees accrued by the Coinbase-incubated Base network.

entry.title: NFT Platform Recur to Shut Down Despite $50M Raise and Big Name Backers
entry.summary: Recur is the latest NFT-centered firm with big-name partnerships to announce its platform is shutting down.

entry.title: 'Failure to State a Claim': Gemini Pushes to Get SEC Case Dismissed
entry.summary: Lawyers for Gemini say the SEC can’t prove the company was selling securities to customers, and wants the lawsuit thrown out.

entry.title: Tornado Cash Sanctions Affirmed by Federal Court
entry.summary: The judge dismissed claims that the sanctions violated the First Amendment rights of Tornado Cash users.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Gitcoin Admits Shell Deal Was a Mistake, Trump’s Crypto Wallet Gets Outed
entry.summary: Twitter was full of unsubstantiated rumors about Tether’s exposure to bankrupt Chinese property giant Evergrande.

entry.title: Token Founder Loses $250,000 and His House in Scam, Sues Crypto.com
entry.summary: The Glow Token CEO says he was duped by scam artists posing as representatives of the major digital currency exchange.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Wants Regular Release From Jail, May Blame Lawyers In His Defense
entry.summary: The FTX founder needs better access to evidence, his lawyers argue, even as his defense may be that his lawyers made him do it.

entry.title: Can Robots Be Beatniks? An AI-Powered Allen Ginsberg Finds Out
entry.summary: A new exhibition in Los Angeles features Ginsberg-esque poems crafted by AI, inspired by the artist’s photographs.

entry.title: Believe In God? You Might Believe In AI, Too
entry.summary: A joint university study suggests that people with a strong belief in God are more willing to trust advice from AI over humans.

entry.title: Scientists Uncover Biological Echoes in Powerful AI Transformer Models
entry.summary: Unassuming astrocytes, thought to merely be helper brain cells, are more than meets the eye.

entry.title: North Korean Hackers Have Stolen $200 Million So Far This Year: Report
entry.summary: Cybercriminals have raked in over $2 Billion over the last five years, TRM Labs says.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Flash Crash! Bitcoin and Ethereum Shed 10% as Altcoins Tumble
entry.summary: A major selloff this week sent the prices of all leading cryptocurrencies spiraling down.

entry.title: Crypto's Oldest Use Case Is Back in the Spotlight. But Why Now?
entry.summary: Tokenization is back in a big way.

entry.title: Mark Cuban, Yuga Labs Lead Backlash Over OpenSea's NFT Royalties Change
entry.summary: OpenSea investor Mark Cuban expressed disappointment in the marketplace's move as creators plot potential boycotts and restrictions.

entry.title: Bitcoin Is Down Bad Again—Here's Why and What Comes Next
entry.summary: Elon or Evergrande—or something else entirely? Experts share what caused Bitcoin's flash crash Thursday, and what to expect ahead.

entry.title: Roblox Enables 'Illicit Gambling' for Kids, Lawsuit Alleges
entry.summary: Roblox is being blamed for third-party online casinos that use its currency, Robux, and facilitate underage gambling. Will the case stick?

entry.title: Elon Musk Says He's Killing Twitter's Block Feature, Sparking Outcry
entry.summary: The Twitter owner revealed plans to axe the block feature, igniting swift backlash among users citing safety concerns on the platform.

entry.title: Another Crypto Bridge Collapses as DeFi Lender on Optimism Suffers $7 Million Attack
entry.summary: Exactly, a credit market on the Optimism network, was hacked on Friday as thieves exploited its bridge to swipe a stash of ETH.

entry.title: Meet the DJ Who Wears a CryptoPunk Helmet While He Spins
entry.summary: With his debut single "Angels" out today, Seedphrase says he understands skepticism but wants to "let the music do the talking."

entry.title: Billionaire Biohacker Who Wants to Live Forever Just Started 'Penis Rejuvenation' Therapy
entry.summary: The 45-year-old Bryan Johnson is undergoing therapy using sound waves to help him attempt to achieve the erections of a healthy 18-year-old.

entry.title: What’s a DAO to Do? Gitcoin Backlash Shows Crypto Governance Is More Than a Meme
entry.summary: Another DAO, another controversy. The latest Gitcoin debacle has revived an age-old question: Are DAOs really better than the firm?

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game’s Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel’s closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdić, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.
